<div class="MMM--grids">
<div class="MMM--grids-col MMM--grids-col_pdpMain">
<ul class="MMM--pdpList SNAPS--bullets">
<li>Protects against transfer of dirt, dust and overspray without blocking natural light</li>
<li>Reduces labor and costs related to removing dirt and overspray from paint booth lights and windows</li>
<li>Clear adhesive backing keeps material secure on vertical surfaces</li>
<li>Applies quickly and removes cleanly for time and cost efficiency</li>
<li>Part of the 3M™ Dirt Trap Surface Protection System for body shops and industrial facilities</li>
</ul>
<p class="SNAPS--pdpTabDes">3M™ Dirt Trap Clear Film Protection Material is a specially engineered covering material that protects    windows and other openings where paint or dust can accumulate, without blocking natural light. This material can also be used to cover openings, preventing drift of dust and overspray. A clear adhesive backing keeps it secure, smooth and wrinkle free, and removes without residue.</p>
<p class="SNAPS--pdpTabDes"><p class="MMM--gapBottom"><strong class="MMM--txt_bold">Clear Film Protects Windows Without Blocking Light</strong><br />
Developed as part of our 3M™ Dirt Trap Surface Protection System, our 3M™ Dirt Trap Clear Film Protection Material traps dust, dirt and paint overspray on windows and other clear openings without blocking natural light in the shop. This clear, durable film saves you the costs of paint and dirt removal from windows, where it can interfere with the work environment. Simply apply it to glass, plexiglass or to the walls surrounding the opening. A clear, low-tack adhesive keeps the film firmly in place. When you’re ready to replace it, the film peels off cleanly without leaving adhesive residue.</p>

<p class="MMM--gapBottom"><strong class="MMM--txt_bold">Part of the 3M™ Dirt Trap Surface Protection System</strong><br />
3M™ Dirt Trap Clear Film Protection Material is just one of our 3M™ Dirt Trap products for complete coverage of areas and equipment such as floors, walls, table tops, paint scales, tread mats, machine rollers and more. 3M™ Dirt Trap Nonwoven Protection Material is designed to trap dust and overspray, ideal for use in the paint booth. Our 3M™ Self-Stick Liquid Protection Fabric is Engineered for the non-stop demands of industrial environments where protection from grease, grime, water, solvents, and other liquids is vital. It is excellent for a range of industries including manufacturing, marine and automotive.</p>

<p class="MMM--gapBottom"><strong class="MMM--txt_bold">The Science of Staying Clean</strong><br />
3M™ Dirt Trap Clear Film Protection Material showcases how 3M applies science to life, helping you create a brighter, cleaner, more efficient collision repair shop. Engineered by 3M with a low tack adhesive backing that keeps it solidly in place yet allows for easy peel-off removal, this material delivers simple solutions that make it easy to get the most out of your shop today and for the future.</p></p>
<p class="SNAPS--pdpTabDes"></p>

<h4 class="MMM--hdg MMM--lgl_dsclmr_hdg">For industrial/occupational use only. Not for consumer sale or use.</h4>
<div class="disclaimerBlock-message" id="disclaimer">3M industrial and occupational products are intended, labeled, and packaged for sale to trained industrial and occupational customers for workplace use.  Unless specifically stated otherwise on the applicable product packaging or literature, these products are not intended, labeled, or packaged for sale to or use by consumers (e.g., for home, personal, primary or secondary school, recreational/sporting, or other uses not described in the applicable product packaging or literature), and must be selected and used in compliance with applicable health and safety regulations and standards (e.g., U.S. OSHA, ANSI), as well as all product literature, user instructions, warnings, and other limitations, and the user must take any action required under any recall, field action, or other product use notice.  Misuse of 3M industrial and occupational products may result in injury, sickness, death, or property damage.  For help with product selection and use, consult your on-site safety professional, industrial hygienist, or other subject matter expert.</div>
